learning_guide_1::milestone_card_3::text: Add More Detail to Your Story
learning_guide_1::markdown_card_1::text:
## Find a character for your story
Choose someone with a story to tell.
learning_guide_1::howto_card_0::text: Next up is a clip card. Use it to add clips of your character.
learning_guide_1::selfeval_card_0::text: Do your action and result clips increase the impact of your story?
learning_guide_1::text_card_0::text: Notice the three clips used in the example. Marvin, the character, is the heart of the story. The action and result tell us what happens to Marvin.
learning_guide_1::text_card_2::text: Review your clips. Make sure the order of your clips tells a complete, simple story.
learning_guide_1::text_card_1::text: Good. Now let's add clips to support the character's story. With the next two clip cards, add an action and result.
learning_guide_1::milestone_card_1::head: Next
learning_guide_1::markdown_card_2::text:
## Great Job!
StoryMaker has plenty of lessons to help you learn more about topics related to this path.
learning_guide_1::markdown_card_0::text:
## The most simple story has three elements:  

• Character  
• Action done by the character  
• Result of the action  

You can combine these elements to tell a simple story. A story needs a main character who must take an action, and at the end audience wants to see the result of that action.
